param.name: taskId
param.para: The identifier of the background task to activate.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: Use the ActivateBackgroundTask method to test the code that handles your background tasks.

summary.para: Disables debug mode for the processes of the specified package.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: This method has no effect if the EnableDebugging method was not previously called for this package.

summary.para: Enables debug mode for the processes of the specified package.

param.name: debuggerCommandLine
param.para: The command line to use to launch processes from this package. This parameter is optional.

param.name: environment
param.para: Any environment strings to pass to processes. This parameter is optional.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: Enabling debug mode has the following effects:

item.description: Optionally enables debugger attach on activation.

remarks.para: To restore normal operation, call the DisableDebugging method.

summary.para: Gets the background tasks that are provided by the specified package.

param.name: packageFullName
param.para: The package full name to query for background tasks.

param.name: taskCount
param.para: The count of taskIds and taskNames entries.

param.name: taskIds
param.para: An array of background task identifiers. You can use these identifiers in the method to activate specified tasks.

param.name: taskNames
param.para: An array of task names that corresponds with background taskIds.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: Both parameters taskIds and taskNames have the same ordering of tasks. If you need to know the user-readable task name associated with taskId[0], refer to taskNames[0].

summary.para: Returns the current execution state of the specified package.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: Debuggers can use the GetPackageExecutionState to understand if the application currently is running, suspending, suspended, or terminated. The GetPackageExecutionState function doesn't provide the state of background tasks running in the package.

param.name: pPackageExecutionStateChangeNotification
param.para: Package state-change notifications are delivered by the function on pPackageExecutionStateChangeNotification.

param.name: pdwCookie
param.para: A unique registration identifier for the current listener. Use this identifier to unregister for package state-change notifications by using the method.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: Notifications are raised when the package enters the running, suspending, and suspended states.

summary.para: Resumes the processes of the package if they are currently suspended.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: Each process receives the Resuming event, which is useful for stepping through your apps as they respond to this event.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Suspends and terminates the non-background portion of the apps associated with the specified package and cancels the background tasks associated with the package.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: Use the StartServicing method to simulate what happens when a package is updated to a newer version. New background task activations are buffered (delayed) until you call the method.

summary.para: Causes background tasks for the specified package to activate in the specified user session.

param.name: sessionId
param.para: The identifier of the session which background tasks are redirected to.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Completes the previous servicing operation that was started by a call to the method.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Stops redirection of background tasks for the specified package.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Suspends the processes of the package if they are currently running.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: The process is not currently running.

remarks.para: Each process receives the Suspending event, which is useful for stepping through your apps as they respond to this event.

summary.para: Terminates all processes for the specified package.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: This method does not suspend the processes first. To test suspension followed by termination, call the Suspend method before calling TerminateAllProcesses.

summary.para: Stops receiving package state-change notifications associated with a previous call to .

param.name: dwCookie
param.para: The notification to cancel. This identifier is returned by a previous call to the method.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: Call the UnregisterForPackageStateChanges to stop receiving package state-change notifications associated with a previous call to the method.

summary.para: Enables debugger developers to control the life cycle of a Windows Store app, such as suspending or resuming.

remarks.para: Any debug options set remain in effect until they are cleared or this interface is released.
For debug settings to take effect on Internet Explorer in the new Windows UI, use "DefaultBrowser_NOPUBLISHERID" as the packageFullName parameter for IPackageDebugSettings methods.
